summary: In Norse mythology, Yggdrasil is a giant, sacred ash tree at the center of the universe. It's mentioned in ancient texts like the Poetic Edda and Prose Edda. The tree has branches reaching into the sky and roots connecting to important wells and springs. Gods meet here for important gatherings. Living inside Yggdrasil are creatures like a dragon, an eagle, and four stags. Scholars believe other names for this tree are Hoddmímis holt, Mímameiðr, and Læraðr. It's a significant symbol in Germanic mythology, representing the connection between different worlds.
title: Yggdrasil
